Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of H&C refusal and procedural fairness breach
Evidence_Assessment: Failure to consider medical evidence on treatment availability in Sierra Leone
Burden_of_Proof: On Applicants to demonstrate sufficient hardship
Legal_Rule: Minister may grant permanent residence under subsection 25(1) on H&C grounds
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for H&C decision; Correctness for procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable assessment of child's best interests, procedural unfairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach of procedural fairness due to non-disclosure of evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Medical evidence regarding treatment in Sierra Leone
Assumption about child living in USA without mother
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging reasonableness and fairness of H&C refusal
Court_Result: Decision quashed, matter remitted for reconsideration by different officer
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision: Subsection 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient hardship, reliance on irrelevant factors
Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds application process
Governing_Rule: Subsection 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
